chargeHist.descr: Theft of Mail (less than 10 pieces of mail)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Herman William Schwartz III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft of Mail (less than 10 pieces of mail), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.204(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Herman William Schwartz III in court, in custody at grant County Jail.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Herman William Schwartz III.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to both charges. State recommends probation for 1 year for Ct 1 and 2 years probation for Ct 2. Conditions of probations are to pay restitution, court costs, and to participate in counseling. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to both counts. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of charges. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Frank heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation for Ct 1 and 2 years probation for Ct 2 with the following conditions: pay restitution, counseling, treatment, programming that DOC deems appropriate, court costs waived. If revoked, 83 day credit given.

Defendant Herman William Schwartz III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Herman William Schwartz III.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Joshua Grabandt sworn and testifies. Exhibit #1 Report, offered and received. Cross. Court takes judicial notice of 21CF279. Comments heard. Court finds probable cause to bind over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Not guilty pleas entered. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Herman William Schwartz III appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail, Attorney Mark Walter Frank for Herman William Schwartz III appeared in court, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Attorney Frank has been appointed in this case. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Herman William Schwartz III appeared by video from GCJ, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explained the charges, penalties and rights to counsel. Atty frank is SPD appointed in case 21CF279. Court advises Defendant he needs to contact SPD asap for representation. Def. provides address of 970 Union St Apt 126, Platteville. indicates this is his ex-mother-in-law appt. State requesting $500 cash bond.  Court orders $500 cash bond.  Status as to counsel set for 3/9/22 at 1:30 pm.
